review_title: Amazing place to grow and make an immediate impact
years_at_company: Amazing place to grow and make an immediate impact
pros:
A very special company with transparent, authentic leadership and goals. I can see what everyone is working on via Asana.
Ability to focus on top 1-2 priorities and have conversations on what won’t get done (rare in my experience).
Great work life balance with reasonable expectations from leadership.
Ability to make an impact given small size of company. Very refreshing as compared to larger, bureaucratic organizations.
Very collaborative environment with low egos yet high caliber people.
cons: None that I can think of.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you’re doing and balance great culture with business results!

review_title: CMB is an amazing place to work!
years_at_company: CMB is an amazing place to work!
pros: The culture internally is amazing. Everyone is extremely good at what they do and passionate about making a huge impact in the dating space.

pros:

pros:
I love working at Coffee Meets Bagel! It feels like a small tight-knit family since we're only around 30 people.

Pros:

-Ideas for Friday - everyone can suggest feature ideas or ideas to improve the company which are shared at Friday all hands meetings
- Happy hour every Friday!
- Our office dog, Holly
- Availability and openness from execs - I see our founders every day and chat with them often
- Tons of room for personal growth and ability to take on new projets
- Generally nice, interesting and funny people to work with
- Great work-life balance and ability to work remotely
- Unlimited paid PTO
cons:
- Compensation could be higher
- Meals only once a week
- No 401K matching
- Office sometimes gets hot
- We're starting to outgrow our office space so booking conference rooms is sometimes a struggle
advice_to_mgmt: - Please give us some of those bougie tech perks that many other companies in the Bay Area have

pros:

pros:
- The coworkers and future employs here are always inline with the companies culture. Each day it's wonderful to walk in and work with people that take the high level goals seriously.

- There is a lot of room to grow into a role. I started very junior in a very specific position and my team has expanded, my title has changed, and I have learned a lot of new things

pros: A lot of ownership. The data drives the product, and you can have an impact on the revenue. You make people fall in love!!

review_title: I totally recommend joining Coffee Meets Bagel
years_at_company: I totally recommend joining Coffee Meets Bagel
pros:
I totally recommend working here. Great vibe. Lots of opportunities to start your own projects. You can greatly advance in what you are good at.
You feel like you are part of something that changes other peoples' lives for better.
Very personal approach, lots of channels to bring your ideas to the table. HR is very oriented on making the workflow as easy as possible. Commitment is rewarded and we appreciate each other's work a lot.
cons: The office is located in a touristy place.

pros: A team of smart engineers and customer focussed team members. The overall work environment is super collaborative and positive.
cons: Continue to grow the team and focus on existing employee happiness & career growth

review_title: It is a great place to work.
years_at_company: It is a great place to work.
pros: It is a great place to work in every way, but the most important aspect to me is that you can really tell that the management and founders really care about the happiness of the people that work there.
cons: I would share if there were any, but really, really I don't have any. Whenever I have brought an issue up to management they addressed it directly and immediately... so at this point I don't actually have anything that can go into the con list.

pros: Classic start-up culture (in a good way), everyone who works here is super smart and driven and you'll have the opportunity to try your hand at different types of things, you're not stuck in your lane. Work hours and benefits are awesome, the product is awesome, and it's just a job and company I feel genuinely excited about each day.
cons: Things can get a little disorganized and crazy at times considering it's comparatively a small operation for a big app, and there can be some disconnect between teams that should be communicating better. The CEO can also be a little out of touch sometimes. Salaries could be more competitive.

review_title: Coffee, Bagels, and a whole lotta delight!
years_at_company: Coffee, Bagels, and a whole lotta delight!
pros: Where do I even begin to describe Coffee Meets Bagel... My work history involves time at for some of the biggest tech companies in the Valley. I switched over to the startup culture to get some leg room in my career. I wanted to work cross-functionally, and be allowed opportunities to do things outside my official job role. And boy oh boy, did I get it! Have an idea? You are heard! Want to try out something new? You got it! New marketing idea? Whip up a presentation and show the team what you've got! CMB's open mind, and positive attitude, makes doing anything at this company a delightful, engaging, and all-around fulfilling experience. I've never felt more valued and appreciated in a role than I do at CMB. Your future at this company is limited only insofar as you limit yourself. Aim for the stars, and that's exactly where you land. The people in this office are what enables all of this. I feel like my brain, my skills, and my abilities are exponentially larger because of the people I work with. I absolutely love working with talented people--it inspires me, and at CMB, I'm inspired everyday.
cons: None are coming to mind!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep making your team feel valued and their career path attainable and clear. Maintain your moral and stand by your values, and that will take us very far in the dating app business.

pros:
The founders care about the company culture. They have weekly company status meetings where the company's financial and product status are shared openly, in a positive but unvarnished way, which is amazing. The goals are clear and consistent. When there's a hiccup in the rollout of a new feature, everyone pitches in to fix it asap.

All employees are supportive and collegial. The work is interesting and it feels great to work on something meaningful.

The compensation seems to be market-rate for a start-up, and I think compares well even established small companies.
cons: They have a single large loft office, which every study shows is the worst office space for employee productivity. Some technical processes are left over from when they were very understaffed and it would be good to unwind them now that the company is better staffed.

pros:
This company will let you shine and use your talent in professional life.
It'a group of really skilled people who work closely as a team.
We have a great atmosphere. It is a pleasure for me to be here and pursue our common goal of bringing people together.
cons: It's not a big corporation if that's somebody's preference.

pros:
- Team is super intelligent and collaborative
- Problems being solved is interesting and challenging
- Fun environment to work in
cons: - Nothing really to say here

review_title: A truly incredible place to work!
years_at_company: A truly incredible place to work!
pros: Coffee Meets Bagel is an amazing place to work. Its full of friendly and interesting people who are a joy to work with. The office has a great vibe and allows freedom to work in the manner that suits you best: at a desk, on the couch or even on the massive beanbag. The work involves solving interesting problems and is very fulfilling.
cons: So many free delicious snacks, i just want to eat all the time...

pros: intelligent, friendly, respectful founders and fun, kind co-workers, company outings and happy hours often
cons: not always a completely inclusive team

pros: It's a supportive work environment that ensures you have everything you need to do your job well. It's a growing company, which means it's a great place to get firsthand experience with scaling problems and solutions. The people are friendly, the office is nice, come work with us!
cons: There can be growing pains, but as mentioned under pros, the company is supportive and tries to maintain its core values.

pros: The work environment is very collaborative. Everyone works together towards a common goal and trusts their team members. I would consider everyone I work with a real friend. Happy to come to work each day.
cons: We're definitely growing, so it can be hard to maintain the same "family" feel.

pros:
As cliche as it may sound, I think great companies come from a collaboration of great people and leadership, and I'm impressed by what CMB has done on this front. Each team member brings their own strengths to the table, and the collaborative culture has ensured that we're always learning from each other. The organization is currently pretty flat and pretty small... there's a lot of opportunity for people with enough initiative to make a big impact.

In my time with the company, I've learned a ton, and I really enjoy working on a consumer-facing problem. It's been great both for my personal and career growth.

I think the prospects of the company are very bright. Our focus on the customer (in part with our excellent CS team) and on women in particular, is paying a lot of dividends. The management is very transparent, which in part comes from the confidence they have in the future of the company.
cons: At times, our hiring criteria are arguably too strict. The company generally hasn't been in a rush to fill open positions, but we've possibly passed on some strong candidates.

pros:
Transparent and honest leadership.
Very inclusive and collaborative company culture.
Smart and hard working coworkers.
cons: Standard technical growing pains can make work a bit stressful at times, but nothing abnormal or beyond reason for a small company.
